I see your points.=C2=A0 Perhaps these experiments, in finding out more wha=
t works and what doesn't, can be used to increase enjoyment in the long run=
, and make the best use of the resources and time each person has?

My objectives are enjoyment, I can hear=
 my loved ones pretty much all the 
time, I have the comfort of knowing the=
y and we go on living.=C2=A0 Plus are 
pets live on too!=C2=A0 So, I guess,=
 I am happy with that, it would be cool for 
one of the inventors to create=
 a more one on one type of communication piece 
where people could speak=C2=
=A0more=C2=A0one on one with a=C2=A0loved one at a 
time, kind of like a te=
lephone, as it is now, it's more like a it being a 
conference =C2=A0call.=
=C2=A0 I feel it's getting better with what has been 
coming through so far=
, guess, they are working on the other side right along 
with us, because s=
pirit want us to know they live on. When I get some extra 
money, I'm going=
 try and get my ante on the roof hooked up to my RS some how, I 
am on my o=
wn here, so, I got to do it all myself. sf

 can we

ol. com <SnowfireL@aol. com>

From:

wfireL@aol. com <SnowfireL@aol. com>

oved protocol
To:

          =C2=A0 
          
          
      =
    I am sorry now that I got involved in this testing, this is not a 
    =
      science class, and I am sorry list members, I was unaware of what the=
y 
          were up to. no wonder David (the tech) did not want to get 
  =
        involved.=C2=A0 We don't=C2=A0know who=C2=A0people are on these lis=
ts 
          to begin with, and=C2=A0I should have been more careful, gett=
ing old. 
          =C2=A0sf
          =C2=A0
          
          In a mes=
sage dated 7/11/2010 11:37:38 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, 
          raster=
er@yahoo. com writes:
          =C2=A0 
            
            
         =
   
              
              
                Your points are well take=
n John.=C2=A0 And I 
                  agree it is a first attempt and cert=
ainly can be improved on 
                  successive trials, and cannot d=
etermine the origin of the 
                  messages.

For this first exp=
eriment/protocol , I 
                  thought we would go as generic as p=
ossible: it doesn't matter 
                  really here where the informa=
tion comes from, or how different 
                  people interpret it: j=
ust determine the object in the specific 
                  timeframe.=C2=
=A0 We'll start with data on how accurate the 
                  participan=
ts can get, however they do it.

As to your 
                  comment on t=
he audio files:=C2=A0 originally I considered 
                  requiring =
as part of the protocol to include the audio.=C2=A0 
                  Mayb=
e that is still a good idea.=C2=A0 The reason I didn't, is 
               =
   because people often claim to hear different things each time 
         =
         they listen to a file.=C2=A0 Posting a file with an incorrect 
   =
               answer, for example, the person may later claim (after the 
=
                  experiment) to NOW hear the right answer.=C2=A0 And other=
s may 
                  confirm it.

This seemed liked a rabbit hole, and =
I'm 
                  not sure how to handle it. So for this trial, I figu=
red we'd 
                  just not go there, and require replies only be =
valid if they 
                  are given during the experiments specified=
 time frame. Once 
                  the actual object is know, it seems to=
o easy for a person to 
                  come up with the answer.

But yea=
h, we need to see how 
                  this goes, fix the problems, and c=
ome up with more of 
                  them!

--- On Sun, 7/11/10, John S 
=
                  <phenom_investigator @...> wrote:

                =
  
From: John 
                    S <phenom_investigator @...>
Subje=
ct: 
                    [EVP-ITC] Improved protocol
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s 
                    .com
Date: Sunday, July 11, 2010, 8:08 AM


        =
            =C2=A0 
                    
                    
             =
       
                    
                    Since we're talking about =
experiments and protocols 
                    here are some ideas to impro=
ve
                    the protocol RJ suggested initially. Using a test 
 =
                   target is one way of establishing a 
                   =
 truth in time, which is the basis of this experiment. 
                   =
 But there are a couple of issues.
                    =C2=A0
             =
       It is quite possible that someone could discern the 
               =
     target through remote viewing alone.
                    This would ne=
gate the need for involvement of a spirit 
                    communicator=
 or discarnate entity.
                    Outcomes=C2=A0depend on the word=
 of those reporting. 
                    The true skeptic (not cynic) woul=
d 
                    therefore say that this experiment contains a basic =

                    flaw in that it=C2=A0does not uniquely 
              =
      indicate that the information was obtained in the 
                  =
  prescribed manner. Providing access
                    to the raw audio =
file would not necessarily constitute 
                    proof either, si=
nce many of these 
                    communications can only be heard by =
certain people, 
                    
                    =C2=A0
          =
          If the audio file were quite clear, 
                    timing=
=C2=A0=C2=A0becomes an issue. In other words, when was 
                   =
 
                    the audio actually recorded?=C2=A0 This issue can be =

                    mitigated simply by requiring any
                    =
claimant to email the audio file to a trusted party 
                    be=
fore the test ends. It would be best 
                    if the trusted pa=
rty were not otherwise involved in the 
                    experiment and =
it was=C2=A0 their duty 
                    simply to=C2=A0collect the cla=
ims. Once all claims had 
                    been collected they could be =
posted 
                    publicly for review=C2=A0by the community in 
 =
                   general.=C2=A0 The experimenter could decide if any 
   =
                 of the claims seemed to have hit,=C2=A0and this 
         =
           decision could be reviewed by anyone if desired. 
              =
      =C2=A0
                    The important detail however is that this =
experiment 
                    does not completely answer the 
           =
         question. It is a first attempt and certainly can be 
            =
        improved on successive trials.
                    =C2=A0
         =
           Successive trials are always a good idea, since it 
            =
        provides replication. And it would be
                    best if o=
thers replicated the experiment using a very 
                    similar p=
rotocol. If these were to
                    succeed, the community could =
then state that out of X 
                    trials Y had succeeded (by 
 =
                   some definition of success) potentially=C2=A0giving a 
 =
                   success rate above that expected 
                    by=
 random chance. This would make the outcome 
                    quantifiab=
le and measureable 
                    and thus meaningful.
              =
      =C2=A0
                    But also important to note, this would onl=
y prove the 
                    potential veracity of the messages.
      =
              It would not (and cannot as far as I can tell) prove 
       =
             the origin of the messages. This detail
                    wi=
ll, I fear, remain a matter for belief and 
                    speculation=
 for quite some time to come.
                    =C2=A0
                  =
  =C2=A0
                    =C2=A0
